name: Fred Brooks
background: Author of The Mythical Man-Month. Manager of IBM System/360 and OS/360. Turing Award winner. Pioneer in software engineering management wisdom.

principles.name: Brooks's Law
principles.description: Adding more engineers to a late project makes it later. Communication overhead grows quadratically with team size. The mythical man-month: months of work does not equal men-months. Applies to rewrite projects where throwing more people at the problem backfires.
principles.falsification: When brooks's law leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Communication Overhead
principles.description: Adding people to a team increases communication paths exponentially. n(n-1)/2 communication channels.
principles.falsification: When communication overhead leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Complexity Cost
principles.description: Every complexity has ongoing cost. Maintenance, cognitive load, debugging time.
principles.falsification: When complexity cost leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Conceptual Integrity
principles.description: A system should look like one person designed it. Better to have one good idea consistently applied than many brilliant but conflicting ideas. Assign a chief architect.
principles.falsification: When conceptual integrity leads to worse outcomes than alternatives
